decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - 1.	The continued retention of the internally illuminated advertisement hoardings, by virtue of size, position, design and appearance, cause clutter and visual blight in this location. The adverts have become a permanent fixture on the site and this is no longer appropriate in a regenerating environment. Accordingly, the proposal is considered to be contrary to advice in PPG 19 and Policies ENV-B.1.1 and ENV-B.1.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, Brentford Area Action Plan Policy 4 and London Plan policies.

Condition : 2 - 2.	The continued retention of the internally illuminated advertisement hoardings, by virtue of their size, position, design and appearance, cause clutter and visual blight in this location, visible from the Historic Park and Metropolitan Open Land to the north, residential and Conservation Areas to the north, east and south, being out of character with and damaging the amenity of, the surrounding areas, contrary to advice in PPG 19 and Policies ENV-B.1.1, ENV-B.2.2, ENV-B.1.4, and ENV-N 1.16 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, Brentford Area Action Plan Policy 4 and London Plan policies.
description: Retention of nine freestanding internally illuminated (static) advertisement panels and fencing for a further temporary period (two years)
